ygData.subject: RE: Looks like Lullaby is broken
ygData.msgSnippet: Hee hee.  I hope that s all it is, but I am not too hopeful as he didn t seem surprised that he saw it vs the level one snake.  He only seemed surprised and
ygData.messageBody:
Hee hee. I hope that's all it is, but I am not too hopeful as he didn't
seem surprised that he saw it vs the level one snake. He only seemed
surprised and upset that we didn't see it too. I was getting almost exactly
20% secondary resists before the patch that put in the message, will have to
see if I get nearly 50% now as well. For me it was 5% R, 20% r, pre-message
path, will let you know what it is now.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Monday, January 31, 2000 10:21 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Looks like Lullaby is broken


From: <kim@...>

On Mon, 31 Jan 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> Oh its worse than that from what I see. Looks like Lullaby has two
effects,
> a stun and a mez? and the second resist is from the mez. On higher level
> mobs I'd expect it nearly never works as there will be three! saves. I
> can't imagine why this song is nerfed this badly. It must be really tough
> to use at levels over 35.

No, I think GZ just screwed up the level dependency formula
for this second save. It works correctly with Pixie Strike -
the "your target resists your attempt to mesmerize it" message
only starts to become common against L35+ mobs. He may have
tried to copy it over for Lullaby, tweak it for Lullaby being
a lower level song, and screwed up there resulting in L1 mobs
resisting as if they were L40+.

I'll try it on some high level mobs (assuming I survive :).

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
